question.title: Target debug_android_application failed (OS Error The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process) in Flutter run
question.body:
I am trying to run my Flutter app using flutter run command, but it failed to run throwing the exceptions as follows:

Target debug_android_application failed: PathAccessException: Cannot copy file to 'D:\Workspace\mobile_app_ver1\build\app\intermediates\flutter\debug\flutter_assets\assets/i18n/en.json', path = 'D:\Workspace\mobile_app_ver1\assets\i18n\en.json' (OS Error: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process.
, errno = 32)


FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':app:compileFlutterBuildDebug'.
> Process 'command 'C:\flutter\bin\flutter.bat'' finished with non-zero exit value 1

* Try:
> Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace.
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.

BUILD FAILED in 28s
Running Gradle task 'assembleDebug'...                             29.5s
Error: Gradle task assembleDebug failed with exit code 1

I tried some possible solutions found in Google and ChatGPT search, but none of them worked for me. What can I try next?

answers.body:
I can build with this temporary code.
Add this code pattern to dart-sdk/lib/io/file_impl.dart:copy()


  Future<File> copy(String newPath) {
    // Check if path contains build intermediates and file already exists
+    if (newPath.contains('build\\app\\intermediates\\flutter') || 
+        newPath.contains('build/app/intermediates/flutter')) {
+      final targetFile = new File(newPath);
+      return targetFile.exists().then((fileExists) {
+        if (fileExists) {
+          return targetFile;
+        }
+        return _dispatchWithNamespace(_IOService.fileCopy, [
+          null,
+          _rawPath,
+          newPath,
+        ]).then((response) {
+          _checkForErrorResponse(response, "Cannot copy file to '$newPath'", path);
+          return new File(newPath);
+        });
+      });
+    }
    return _dispatchWithNamespace(_IOService.fileCopy, [
      null,
      _rawPath,
      newPath,
    ]).then((response) {
      _checkForErrorResponse(response, "Cannot copy file to '$newPath'", path);
      return new File(newPath);
    });
  }

And you can copy whole assets files to here manually.

{workingdir}\build\app\intermediates\flutter\{debug/release}\flutter_assets\{xxx}'

And build app

question_comments.body: I am having same issue. cannot resolve using any method. windows.
@blue-pine I fixed up this issue by changing the location of the project folder. Can you try if it works?
How can you fix it? @RisingstarJ. I also had same issue now
@halfer I already did it. No trick.
Could you try exiting your IDE or mobile emulator before trying that command again?
